intro: Randia vitiensis, commonly known as Vitiensis randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia vitiensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
